title: Standardize choose_action errors with machine-readable codes
description:
choose_action currently returns human-readable error strings (e.g. "Index 0 out of range") that require brittle text matching in clients and analysis tooling.

Proposed direction:
1. Add a stable error contract: error_code, retryable, expected_response_type, and action_context hints.
2. Keep human-readable error for logs/UI, but make machine fields authoritative.
3. Align all failure paths (missing param, index out of range, required target, invalid text choice, etc.).

Motivation:
- Easier auto-recovery and retries without regex matching.
- Cleaner telemetry and dashboards for failure categorization.
- Better prompting/agent behavior feedback loops.

Suggested source area: Mage.Client.Headless/src/main/java/mage/client/headless/BridgeCallbackHandler.java:chooseAction and Mage.Client.Headless/src/main/java/mage/client/headless/McpServer.java tool schema.
